column4: Uhm, I'm having some problems with an install of Ubuntu, it freezes at the install screen
So I'm on the Live CD and I need to rescue some data from that!
But I can't mount the drive :(
So I guess what I need to do is to mount a drive
Er how do I mount an HDD?
sudo mount /dev/hd?? /mount/point  ...  where hd?? is the drive and partition number, and /mount/point is the folder you want t omount it
you may also need to specify a file type, which is done with -t
sudo mount /dev/hd?? /mount/point  ...  where hd?? is the drive and partition number, and /mount/point is the folder you want t omount it
So what exactly is the command?
Okay
sudo mkdir /media/ubuntu && sudo mount /dev/hda2 /medi /ubuntu
sudo mkdir /media/ubuntu && sudo mount /dev/hda2 /media/ubuntu
Okay I'll give it a shot
errr replace hda2 with sda1 or whatever
ubuntu@ubuntu:~$ sudo mkdir /medi/ubuntu && sudo mount /dev/sda1 /media/ubuntu
sudo mkdir /media/ubuntu && sudo mount /dev/sda1 /media/ubuntu           .........youre missing an a there
ubuntu@ubuntu:~$  sudo mkdir /media/ubuntu && sudo mount /dev/sda1 /media/ubuntu
sudo mount /dev/sda1 /media/ubuntu         ... alone then
ubuntu@ubuntu:~$ sudo chmod +755 /media/ubuntu
still can't *expore* it
